Kim Jong Un: Here are some interesting facts about North Korea's absolute master

From allegedly obliterating family members to executing an ex-girlfriend to killing a deputy with mortars, Kim makes sure he continues to North Korea's absolute master.

Last Updated: Jun 02, 2018, 11.12 PM IST

0Comments

Call him the Young Master, Marshal, Brilliant Comrade or Yongmyong-Han Tongji, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is one of a kind. From allegedly obliterating family members to executing an ex-girlfriend to killing a deputy with mortars — not to mention nuclear proliferation — Kim makes sure he continues to North Korea's absolute master. As he meets US President Donald Trump on June 12, ET Magazine checks out Kim's reign as a leader.

* Kim is the first North Korean leader to be born after the country's founding in 1948.

* He may be the youngest world leader, but no one is sure of his actual age. Some say he was born in either 1982, 1983 or 1984

* At 27, he underwent plastic surgery to allegedly resemble his grandfather Kim Il Sung

* At 29, the Onion announced him as the “Sexiest Man Alive” for the year 2012.

* Onion is a satirical news source, so we can figure

* At the demise of his grandfather Kim Il Sung, his father Kim Jong Il made sure that the country grieved massively

* Members of the Moranbong Band, were specially hand-picked by the Kim to form North Korea's first-ever all-female band. The quintet made their debut in 2012

* The Interview, a 2014 American action-comedy film stars Seth Rogen and James Franco as journalists who set up an interview with Kim Jong Un, and are recruited by the CIA to assassinate him

* The North Korean government threatened action against the US if Columbia Pictures released the film. Columbia delayed the release and re-edited the film to make it more acceptable to North Korea.

* In November, the computer systems of parent company Sony Pictures Entertainment were hacked by the "Guardians of Peace", a group the FBI claims has ties to North Korea. The group also threatened terrorist attacks against cinemas that showed the film. Major cinema chains opted not to release the film, leading Sony to release it for online rental

* His haircut is very popular in the country and even has a name — Ambitious. Male university students were asked to copy his haircut. Apparently, North Koreans must abide by one of 28 approved haircuts — unmarried women must have short hair, young men’s hair should be less than 2 inches, older men can go as long as 2¾ inches

From strange fibs to outrageous lies, here are some of the craziest claims by the North Korean dictator:

Wonder Drug

North Korea has created a wonder drug which not only cures AIDS, but also eradicates Ebola and cancer. Known as Kumdang 2, the scientists refused to share the drug’s details

Unicorns

In 2012, researchers claimed to have discovered a real-life unicorn lair, just a short distance away from a sacred temple in Pyongyang

Child Prodigy?

In 2015, according to a new curriculum Kim reportedly could drive by the time he was three, was winning yachting races at nine, and was also an expert artist and musical composer at a young age

Here is a brief timeline of Kim Jong Un's life April 2009: Appointed to North Korea's National Defense Commission

September 2010: Promoted to four-star general and named vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission as well as to the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea

December 2011: After the death of his father Kim Jong Il, Kim assumes command of the North Korean army

July 2012: Kim is given the title marshal of the army

March 2014: Kim is unanimously elected as Deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK, with 100% turnout

December 2015: Kim claims North Korea has added the hydrogen bomb to its nuclear arsenal

July 2016: The Obama administration imposes sanctions on Kim and 10 other regime officials for their alleged complicity in human rights abuses against the North Korean people. The move marks the first time Washington has sanctioned Kim personally

September 2016: South Korea's Defense Minister announces that South Korea has elite troops on standby ready to assassinate Kim Jong Un if the country feels threatened by North Korean nuclear weapons

January 2017: Kim claims North Korea is almost ready to begin testing intercontinental ballistic missiles

February 2017: Kim's half-brother, Kim Jong Nam, dies after being poisoned at Malaysia's Kuala Lumpur International Airport. South Korea's intelligence agency later says that Kim ordered his death

September 2017: Trump threatens to "totally destroy" North Korea if the US is forced to defend itself or an ally. Kim makes a rare statement, saying Trump will "pay dearly" and "I will surely and definitely tame the mentally deranged US dotard with fire"

February 2018: Extends a formal invitation to South Korean President Moon Jae-in to travel to North Korea. Kim Yo Jong, Kim Jong Un's younger sister, presents the invite at Seoul's presidential palace, marking the first time that a member of the North's ruling dynasty has visited since the Korean War, which ended in an armistice in 1953

March 2018: The White House announces that Trump has agreed to meet Kim. The talks would be the first between a sitting US president and a North Korean leader

March 2018: Kim makes a surprise trip to Beijing and meets with President Xi Jinping. The trip is Kim's first abroad since he took the reins after his father, Kim Jong Il, died in late 2011

April 2018: During a day-long summit, Kim and Moon Jae-in pledge to formally end the Korean War, 65 years after hostilities ceased

(Source: edition.cnn.com, therichest.cim, media reports)
